column1: Art Institute of Chicago////And this contract of convenience had a brilliant side effect: because it presented the many Paintings in the "Context" of a single collection - which left the MASTERPIECE game (in comparison to all other text books or flashcard sets bent on teaching Art History)
column2: the only learning tool that focused on a single museum's collection - so that playing the game was like visiting the museum itself. Then to package that learning tool as a fun family game
column3: where the player who knew the most about each painting
column4: Won - was brilliant. Too bad the game is so hard to get now.
